div.p: A.O.S. 96 was established in 2010. Local towns joined together to more efficiently serve students and tax payers. The Alternative Organizational Stucture consists of the towns of Cutler, East Machias, Jonesboro, Machias, Machiasport, Marshfield, Northfield, Roque Bluffs, Wesley, Whiting, Whitneyville.

p.strong: Important Message from AOS 96 Superintendent of Schools

br.br:
As many of you are already aware, on April 7, 2020, the Maine Commissioner of Education, with the support of Governor Mills, made the recommendation for Maine schools to extend their distance learning plans until the end of the current school year. As a result of this recommendation, all AOS 96 school personnel will make plans to extend distance learning for the remainder of the school year with the hope that the Covid-19 crisis will end sooner than expected. If this crisis does end earlier than expected, then we would intend to return to school if we have obtained Federal, State, CDC and local recommendations to do so. The safety of our students and staff is of utmost importance to all of us.
Throughout this crisis, I have been extraordinarily proud of the work of our AOS 96 principals, teachers, and support staff. Teaching remotely has been challenging to plan for and deliver to our students. I thank our dedicated staff for doing what it takes to continue educating our students, but I also appreciate their efforts to check in on our students each week to see how they are doing in these difficult times. I also thank our students for doing their best to keep up with the workload that is sent home or delivered on-line. We know it not easy to stay focused in the midst of a pandemic. We also know it is very difficult for our parents to balance work and the responsibilities of taking care of children while helping to educate each child. Thank you for the help all of you have been supporting our efforts to ensure that we continue the education process even through the toughest of times.

div.p:
I want all of you to know if we are unable to return to school by the end of the school year, we are committed to making time to celebrate graduations and other end of the year activities. I feel bad for all of our students that have endured this school closure, but I know it is especially disappointing for our 8th graders and seniors. You have all missed valuable academic time, but many others have lost a complete athletic season. Although we cannot make up the athletic season, we will be able to schedule graduations and other events this summer if we do not return to school. I think we all know how important these milestones are for students and their families. We will do our best to make these events meaningful and memorable.
Again, I thank you for everything you all have done to meet the needs of our AOS 96 students.
Please contact your AOS 96 building principal or me anytime at super@aos96.org if you have questions or concerns about our school closure.

Stay Safe,
Scott K. Porter
Superintendent of Schools
AOS 96
Machias Bay Area School System

Welcome
Shared Services- the A.O.S. structure allows for use of shared services by all 11 member towns for their schools.
One of the shared services is that of our Curriculum Coordinator, Mitchell Look. Mitchell works out of the Central Office and is also the principal of the Wesley School.
Special Education Services are shared as well. These services are managed by Mary Maker who also works from the Central Office.
